sponsor.partnerMessage: Looking to get your product off the shelf and into carts? Soapbox Influence exists to build brands through authentic conversion with influencer marketing, shopper insights, and social media management.

posts.title: Community Created and Community Driven Sustainability
posts.content:
Ozark Compost was created for the NWA community to drive positive environmental impacts through compost pickup and zero-waste products, all at the convenience of your doorstep.  Join the hundreds of homes and businesses driving big impacts.

  • Convenient composting: With easy-to-follow compost guides, customer support, and text notifications, composting could not be easier. Fill up your 5-gal bucket with compostable items and OCS will pick it up and swap it for a clean one on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.  This Spring, composters will also be receiving givebacks.
  • Conscious consumption: Include a subscription for ground or whole-bean Airship coffee with your deliveries, and find eco-friendly, zero-waste products on Ozark Compost's online shop.

The first 10 NWA Daily readers to sign up will receive a free month of bi-weekly pickups. If you add a coffee subscription, we will throw in the refillable coffee canister.  Use code OCS2023 or click HERE

posts.title: SoNA Prepares For Final Three Shows Of The Season
posts.content:
The Symphony of Northwest Arkansas has been selling out back-to-back shows during its 2022-23 MainStage season at Walton Arts Center, and there are just three shows left to get in on the action.

  • Marching on: Presenting New Canons on Mar 11, the symphony will showcase pieces from its upcoming album, such as Trevor New's Cohere I, Paul Haas's In saecula saeculorum, and a performance of Johannes Brahms's Symphony No. 3 in F Major.
  • April showers: Battle of the Bands on Apr 8 will bring SoNA and the Fayetteville Jazz Collective together for an evening of genre-defying music, then the season will wrap up on Apr 29 with Evoking Folklore, a storytelling experience featuring pianist Angela Chang.

Secure the best seats for the three remaining shows this season by purchasing a mini-subscription HERE.

posts.title: Lady Warriors Strengthening Community With Women-Only Gym
posts.content:
Lady Warriors in Bentonville is a women-only gym and lifestyle transformation studio committed to helping you become the best version of yourself through goal-setting, accountability coaching, and workouts that will leave you feeling like a true warrior.

  • Reaching goals: Through individualized training and group classes, members are guided by experienced coaches and trainers who provide nutrition guidance, around-the-clock accountability, and support.
  • Secure training: Classes use movements typical in women's daily lives with an emphasis on proper form and technique to prevent injury while providing a safe and judgment-free environment.

Start your health journey and sign up for a free consultation HERE.

posts.title: MIXD Gallery Highlights Humanity's Relationship With The Environment Second Art Drop
posts.content:
MIXD Gallery in Rogers unveiled its second art exhibition last weekend. Titled Natural Beings, the collection explores the relationship between a creature and its environment.

  • Northwest Art-kansas: MIXD Gallery bridges Bentonville's renowned museums and the U of A's School of Art in Fayetteville, opening a space for the diverse group of artists in the Ozark region to host creative conversations and showcase local talent through quarterly drops.
  • Connected: Natural Beings exhibition features traditional landscapes and portraiture highlighting the interconnected relationship between humanity and our natural surroundings, exploring how one subject may affect the other.

Natural Beings will be on display until May 24. Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Terra Studios Prepares For Spring Break Palooza
posts.content:
Terra Studios, the glass and pottery studio famous for the Bluebird of Happiness, is preparing for its Spring Break Palooza, Mar 22-26, featuring live music, an array of local food trucks, and art classes to unleash your inner creative. 

  • Fairytales: Nestled in the Ozark hills about 30 minutes southeast of Fayetteville, Terra Studios is a magical wonderland of art where visitors can immerse themselves in the beauty of sparkling glass sculptures, fantasy creatures, and peaceful gardens created by hundreds of artists. You'll feel like you've stepped into a fairyland.
  • Feel artsy: Sign up for an art class and learn how to make pinch pots and clay bunnies, or join the Art Lab open to all visitors on Friday, Mar 24, and create your own Bluebird of Happiness using model magic clay.

Register for a Spring Break Palooza class at Terra Studios HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Getting to know you: We're trying to learn more about our audience to serve you better. To do this, we're conducting an anonymous survey, and we would LOVE for you to help us by filling it out!
  • Boredom begone: Looking for more ways to enjoy the Natural State? About You just shared a list of 100+ things to do in Arkansas.
  • Not all heroes wear capes: A Bentonville second-grader melted hearts at R.E. Baker Elementary last week when she showed up to Superhero Day dressed up like her teacher, Jaime Deigh.
  • Take a sip: PopUp Drink Thru is about to open at 2001 SW Regional Airport at Bright in Bentonville, serving up a delicious mix of energy drinks, coffee, tea, sparkling water, shakes, chais, and cookies at
  • All in green: Join the New Beginnings Residents at Fayetteville City Hall tonight, from 5-8p, to advocate using ARPA funds to create supportive housing in our community! Wear green to show your support!
  • 💸 Want to help NWA Daily keep curating great content AND have access to EXCLUSIVE giveaways? Become a Fan of NWA Daily.
  • 🚀 Want your message to reach our 26,000+ subscribers? Fill out this form or shoot us an email.

*Content is sponsored
